main event: Observers sighted a metallic round flat disc flying at a high altitude over Glendale, California, on 8 April 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed flying northwest at high speed, resembling a disc with a thick center tapering to thin edges,Many witnesses agreed on the object's appearance and flight path,The disc left a very thin dark trail that dissipated immediately,It appeared to shimmer and glisten in the sunlight,The weather during the observation was clear with excellent visibility, and no other aircraft were reported in the area at the time.
witness description: City employees from the Parks and Recreation Department, described as reliable individuals with above-average intelligence
